children.value: Cloudflare Analytics offers a range of data sets, including both general and product-specific data sets. Data sets use a consistent naming scheme that explicitly identifies the type of data they return:

Each data set is named after the domain it describes and is associated with a set of nodes. Data nodes are typically named after the domain they represent. Product-specific data nodes incorporate the name of the relevant product, as in
. Network Analytics data nodes incorporate the
Nodes that represent aggregated data include the
node represents aggregated data for Load Balancing requests. Aggregated data returns in an array of
objects. If the data represented by a node is aggregated prior to query time, the aggregation period is also specified. For example,
represents data aggregated into a collection of minute-wise roll-up reports.
, are not aggregated and so do not incorporate the
suffix. Raw data returns in arrays containing objects of the relevant data type. For example, a query to

The following data sets (and associated nodes) are available in Cloudflare Analytics:
Beta data sets are available to Enterprise customers for testing and exploration. Do not rely on beta data nodes, since they are subject to change or removal without notice.
The following data nodes are deprecated. To avoid disruption, migrate to replacement nodes before the sunset date.

Every field, including nested fields, has a type and represents a list of that type.
